title: Slack notifications with multiple tabs open in random tab
content:
At my software development job, we use Slack. This means two things: (1) I have at least one Slack tab open at all times; and (2) there are links to Slack threads in our JIRA issues.

Suppose I start working on an issue. I click on a Slack link from that issue, to get the necessary context. Now I have two Slack tabs open.

Next, someone posts to a channel I’m subscribed to. A desktop notification pops up.

When I click the Activate button in the notification, it activates one of the Slack tabs I have, and opens the newly posted message in this tab. It seems to choose to activate the most recently active Slack tab. Depending on what I was doing, that may be the tab I opened for reference. This may then switch me away from the reference thread, destroying my context. I then have to click “Back” one or more times in order to get the context back.

Is it possible to control which tabs notifications activate? All else being equal, I would like Slack notifications select the tab that is pinned, or the one opened least recently, or the one that was was NOT opened by following a link from another site.

Slack support says they don’t control which tab gets activated. They suggest that I install and use the standalone Slack desktop application, but I do not want that because it does not afford me the same degree of customizability as Firefox does.
creator: yurivkhan

title: Print Preview is gone and changing print.tab_modal.enabled to false does not fix it
content:
As many people have said, replacing Print Preview with a "new print experience" creates a huge hardship for many users. Not only does it save paper, but the "Simplify" button allows the printing of pages that otherwise cannot be printed.

When the new print experience was first rolled out, I was able to revert back to Print Preview as described in the support forum here, and all was well for about three months.

Print Preview disappeared again last week, and changing print.tab_modal.enabled to false does NOT fix it this time. There is no corresponding app.normandy switch. This happened on two different computers whose browsers are not synced with each other.

Some advisers have said that clicking "use the system dialogue" gives access to Print Preview, but that is not the case on either of these computers.

Running Windows 10 Home and FireFox 97.0 (64 bit) on both machines.

Please help.

title: Visiting Any Webpage Appears Blank, then Firefox Crashes
content:
Hi,

After updating Firefox version 97, any webpage I visit doesn't load. For example, when I open Firefox and visit youtube.com, it gets stuck on a blank continuously loading white page. When I close and attempt to re-open Firefox, it doesn't open until I task kill firefox.exe. Interestingly, there are multiple instances of firefox.exe open when I task kill.

Here are all the basic fixes I tried but to no avail:

- Ensured all drivers and Windows Updates are up-to-date - Started Firefox in Safe Mode and disabled all add-ons - Uninstall Firefox then reinstall - Rename all the Mozilla folders in %appdata% to Mozilla.old - Delete the residual Mozilla folder in Program Files - Delete all Mozilla keys in the registry (HKLM\SOFTWARE\Mozilla, HKCU\SOFTWARE\Mozilla) - Ran sfc /scannow, dism /online /cleanup-image /restorehealth, chkdsk c: /f - Checked c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts file to ensure no odd entries - Checked network and DNS settings for anything out of the ordinary

Here is my system information:

Windows 10 Pro 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044 Intel i7-4790 8 Gbs memory 512 SSD

This issue has left me stumped, and I think it may have something to do with v97 (even though it works fine on my other PC). Does anyone have any suggestions on fixing this issue (other than wiping the PC)? Please note that different browsers such as Edge and Chrome work perfectly fine. Let me know if you could use more information. Thanks in advance!

Regards, Adrian
creator: adrian.gaviola

here is my latest crash report ID: bp-b4c1f3b4-b6a8-4201-b6b4-dfc100220215

Thanks for your comments!
creator: kamusgallagher

title: Attn:  Jscher2000    Re Display All Bookmarks (not just folders) in New FF Window
content:
Hi again J 

   Older thread  https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1284813    now closed of course.        You suggested    "If you paste the following address to the address bar of a new window and press Enter to load it, you have largely the same functionality:"

chrome://browser/content/places/bookmarksSidebar.xhtml 

   Good idea.   Yes, "largely."   Then I bookmarked "that page"   And then pinned/locked that 'bookmark' as a tab in my Default Session.         Then ...

"You can hold the Shift key and left-click the bookmark to open the bookmark (link) in a new window. This should always work to open a link in a new window." Mozilla Support. Which it does. 

   Bingo.     Standard browser window.   Separate Window with All folders and All bookmarks in a ONE PANE in its own window, so any and all bookmarks are visible concurrently.    The Browser and Bookmarks show on Taskbar as two icons for toggling ("never combine")  and the critical functionality from ancient FF 3.26 (not the portable) and later via AiOS or "Good 'Ol Sidebar" is back in business.      Took me awhile for the opportunity to investigate this, but I appreciate your experience and patience.    Cheers!
creator: pietertvl1
